results.title: The Genie from down under: customs
results.creator_credit: Phil Jones, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, ABC-TV (Australia), British Broadcasting Corporation and Jeremy Swan
results.brief_description: Penelope, Lady Diana and Miss Mossop are arrested by a Customs Officer when they return to England with 20 million pounds provided by the genies. That exact amount has just gone missing from the Royal Mint.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Phil Jones, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children’s Television Foundation, ABC-TV (Australia), British Broadcasting Corporation and Jeremy Swan

results.title: The Genie from down under: good cop, bad genie
results.creator_credit: Phil Jones, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, ABC-TV (Australia), British Broadcasting Corporation and Brendan Maher
results.brief_description: Penelope is desperate to win the Cross Country and she does - without any help from the genies. Penelope wishes that Conrad could see her success. He does - but not quite how Penelope would have liked.

results.title: Errol Flynn
results.creator_credit: Michael Carson, Pamela Vanneck, Ron Saunders and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Willesee’s Australians”.
This moving drama series on important figures from Australia’s past brings Australian history to life. Errol Flynn’s natural charm and good looks saw him become a screen legend as Hollywood’s greatest swashbuckling lover and matinee idol. This film takes an irreverent look at the nineteen year old Flynn’s escapades in Sydney as he sets off on the path to notoriety.

results.title: The Genie from down under: where it's at
results.creator_credit: Phil Jones, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, ABC-TV (Australia), British Broadcasting Corporation and Esben Storm
results.brief_description: Bruce wants to become human but to do this he must take the opal to the cave where it was mined over a hundred years before. He sets out to trick Penelope into visiting the cave.

results.title: The Genie from down under: it's my opal and I'll cry if I want to
results.creator_credit: Phil Jones, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, ABC-TV (Australia), British Broadcasting Corporation and Jeremy Swan
results.brief_description: Tour operator, Otto von Meister, and his nephew, Conrad, arrive at Townes Downs with a load of tourists. When he learns about the opal Otto recalls that it belonged to their family years before and he and Conrad are desperate to get it back.

results.title: The Esso Australian Jazz Summit
results.brief_description: Sydney’s famous Bondi Beach came alive with a foot-tapping, head-nodding event, the First Australian Jazz Summit. All styles of jazz were represented, from modern, traditional through to avant-garde. Various ensembles and configurations of players performed, from standard groups to Big Bands, feature soloists and, of course, jam sessions and improvisation. Rated: G

results.title: The Genie from down under: wishing and hoping
results.creator_credit: Phil Jones, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, ABC-TV (Australia), British Broadcasting Corporation and Esben Storm
results.brief_description: When upper class English girl Penelope Townes finds a magic opal which contains two Australian genies, Bruce and his son Baz, she thinks all her problems are over, and that she can have anything she wants. Bruce, however, has other ideas.

results.title: Women of the iron frontier
results.creator_credit: Lilias Fraser, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Fraser Film and Video
results.brief_description: Filmed in the remote Pilbara region in far north Western Australia this is a moving revelation of the struggle of women who are trying to create a life for themselves in the hostile environment of outback iron ore mining towns. “Time goes very slowly” deals with the problems of isolation and unemployment for women in Newman. “It’s not a community anymore” tells of the ongoing effects of the bitter 1986 Robe River industrial dispute upon families in the town of Wickham. “It’s supposed to be a town” explores racism through the eyes of both the black and white women of Newman.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lilias Fraser, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Fraser Film and Video

results.title: A Town like Alice
results.creator_credit: Henry Crawford, Crawford Productions and David Stevens
results.brief_description: Based on Nevil Shute’s best selling novel, “A Town Like Alice” is set against the brutal chaos of World War 11 and centres on two prisoners of war an Englishwoman, Jean Paget and an Australian soldier Joe Harmon, whose romance begins during the takeover of Malaya in World War 11 and takes them to the vast Australian outback.
